intro: Pilosella pratensis, commonly known as meadow pilosella, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Pilosella pratensis is often found in temperate regions across Europe and parts of Asia.
